modelIdentification.name: Patient
modelIdentification.releaseRestriction: TBD by US Government (expected to be "Unlimited Release")
modelIdentification.purpose: The Patient Module will be used to model patients, their injuries and the treatments administered to them.
modelIdentification.description:
Patient module: all ground truth data related to the patient. Any data in this module will represent the true patient. Data can be from a physiology engine or instructor input.
Multiple Patient instances may be created. Each Patient instance may have zero or more injuries and zero or more treatments. Patient, injuries and treatments are all associated by a unique patientId.
modelIdentification.useLimitation: The Medical Modeling and Simulation Federation Object Model by Information Visualization and Innovative Research, Inc. is licensed under CC BY-ND 4.0. To view a copy of this license, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nd/4.0/

poc.pocOrg: Information Visualization and Innovative Research Inc.

modelIdentification.other: Resources: MedBiquitous; Medical Device Innovation Consortium (MDIC) ; SNOMED; Biogears; HUMMOD

objectClass.name: Physiology
objectClass.semantics: Physiology object: ground truth data provided by the physiology engine or equivalent simulator control software. Note that while these variables can be measured and reported by the learner, a different module (comms, instructional) is responsible for accounting for the measured values. Examples: • heart rate • respiration rate • systolic and diastolic blood pressure

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular injuryId.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: heartRate
attribute.semantics: Beats per minute

attribute.name: diastolicBloodPressure
attribute.semantics: mm HG expressed as an integer.

attribute.name: systolicBloodPressure
attribute.semantics: mm HG expressed as an integer

attribute.name: peripheralOxygenSaturation
attribute.semantics: SPO2 Blood Oxygen Level expressed as real value .80 = 80%

attribute.name: temperatureFahrenheit
attribute.semantics: Temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.

attribute.name: respirationEndTidalCarbonDioxide
attribute.semantics: Expressed in mmHg.

attribute.name: respirationRate
attribute.semantics: Respiration rate expressed in number of breaths per minute.

attribute.name: lungTidalVolume
attribute.semantics: Units mL.

attribute.name: lungDeadSpace
attribute.semantics: Units mL.

attribute.name: lungTotalCapacity
attribute.semantics: Units mL.

attribute.name: lungExpiratoryReserve
attribute.semantics: Units mL.

attribute.name: lungInspiratoryReserve
attribute.semantics: Units mL.

attribute.name: lungResidualVolume
attribute.semantics: Units mL.

objectClass.name: Signs
objectClass.semantics:
A sign is a physical response to an injury or condition. Signs can be noticed externally and can be observed or measured by a provider.
Note that some measurable signs are modeled in the Physiology class. A "Signs" monitor simulation would need to subscribe to both the Physiology and Signs classes

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: signLocation
attribute.semantics: May be null. Identifies where a sign is located on the body.

attribute.name: confusion
attribute.semantics: Visible signs of confusion that the medic might observe or assess. True/1 = confusion, False/0 = no confusion.

attribute.name: skinColor
attribute.semantics: Description of the skin complexion due to conditions or injuries. Does not describe the patient’s base skin color, but identifies differences from the base color.

attribute.name: skinRash
attribute.semantics: May be null. If rash exists, describes presentation of the rash.

attribute.name: skinMoisture
attribute.semantics: Identifies if patient is sweating. True/1 = Sweating, False/0 = not sweating.

attribute.name: cough
attribute.semantics: Describes type of cough.

objectClass.name: Symptoms
objectClass.semantics: Symptoms object: Perceived truth about breaks in the normal condition of the body. It is something a patient feels and reports to the provider. The symptom can be measured by a value as rated by the patient. “Worst stomach ache I have ever experienced.” “Pain is a 7 on a scale of 1-10.” For the patient module, these are created by the scenario, instructor, or physiology engine. See Signs class for additional information

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: symptomLocation
attribute.semantics: May be null. Identifies where the patient is feeling the symptom.

attribute.name: dizziness
attribute.semantics: Identifies if patient reports dizziness. True/1 = dizzy, False/0 = not dizzy.

attribute.name: nausea
attribute.semantics: Identifies if patient reports nausea. True/1 = nausea, False/0 = no nausea.

attribute.name: levelOfPain
attribute.semantics: Level of pain 0-10

attribute.name: fatigue
attribute.semantics: Identifies if patient reports fatigue. True/1 = fatigue, False/0 = no fatigue.

attribute.name: numbness
attribute.semantics: Identifies if patient reports numbness. True/1 = numbness, False/0 = no numbness.

attribute.name: visionDisturbance
attribute.semantics: May be null. If patient experiences issues with their vision, they describe the type of vision they are experiencing to the provider. This only describes differences to normal, baseline vision of the patient.

objectClass.name: Injury
objectClass.semantics:
The operational name of the patient’s injury, along with information describing the severity and effect of the injury on the patient. The effect can be used to adjust the physiology engine model of the patient.
The injurySeverity scale will be translated by the physiology engine into its own variables. Some injuries will require more than a simple severity scale, and those effects are captured in subclasses.

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics: patientId associates a particular patient to a particular injuryId.

attribute.name: injuryId
attribute.semantics: Used to identify a particular injury and related physiological insult.

attribute.name: time
attribute.semantics: This optional attribute indicates the time of injury in simulation elapsed time. If null, the injury time is current time.

attribute.name: injuryLocation
attribute.semantics: Enumerations of the body locations an injury could occur

attribute.name: injuryType
attribute.semantics: Represents an injury inflicted on a patient using operational or descriptive language.

attribute.name: injuryDescription
attribute.semantics: May be null. A plain text physical description of the injury to provide additional context if needed.

attribute.name: injurySeverity
attribute.semantics: Scale 0 to 10 of injury severity, with 1 being minimal severity and 10 being maximum severity. 0 is used for effects that are fully described by a subclass instead.

objectClass.name: HemorrhageInjury
objectClass.semantics: Sets the hemorrhage rate. Does not require an additional severity score.

attribute.name: hemorrhageRate
attribute.semantics: The rate of hemorrhage measured in mL per minute

objectClass.name: BurnInjury
objectClass.semantics: Describes the parameters of a burn injury. Does not require an additional severity score.

attribute.name: totalBodySurfaceArea
attribute.semantics: The percentage of body area covered by the burn, expressed as a decimal (0.25 = 25% TBSA)

attribute.name: burnType
attribute.semantics: Describes the type of burn.

attribute.name: burnDegree
attribute.semantics: Describes the degree of the burn

objectClass.name: TissueDamageInjury
objectClass.semantics: Describes the type of issue damaged in a soft tissue injury. Requires an additional severity score.

attribute.name: tissueType
attribute.semantics: The type of tissue that is damaged.

objectClass.name: ImmuneResponseInjury
objectClass.semantics: This class identifies the general type of immune response to model. Ideally, a specific disease will be selected from InjuryType to allow the engine to model that specific disease. However if that model is not available, this class can be used to indicate a generic type of immune response.

attribute.name: immuneTrigger
attribute.semantics: Type of immune response.

objectClass.name: RadiationInjury
objectClass.semantics: Describes the radiation dose. Requires an additional severity score.

attribute.name: exposureTime
attribute.semantics: The time of exposure to the radiation, expressed in seconds.

objectClass.name: ChemicaIngestionlInjury
objectClass.semantics: Describes a chemical or poison ingestion. Does not require an additional severity score.

attribute.name: chemicalPH
attribute.semantics: pH of the chemical (used instead of identifying the specific chemical to allow for more general reactions).

attribute.name: chemicalExposure
attribute.semantics: Identifies if the exposure was external (surface contact) or internal (injected or ingested). 0 = external, 1 = internal

attribute.name: chemicalDosage
attribute.semantics: Dosage of the chemical, expressed in mL or mg

objectClass.name: EnvenomationInjury
objectClass.semantics: Describes the venom dose. Does not require an additional severity score.

attribute.name: venomType
attribute.semantics: The classification of the venom type. The type affects the body’s response to the venom.

attribute.name: venomDose
attribute.semantics: Amount of venom measured in mL or mg.

objectClass.name: Treatment
objectClass.semantics:
This class is not meant to be published or subscribed. Rather use the subclasses of MedicationTreatmentl and PhysicalTreatment.
The procedure performed by the medical provider that impacts the patient's physiology.
Each Treatment Instance will have a unique treatmentId. Once a treatmentId is used, it cannot be reused during an execution.

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular injuryId.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: injuryId
attribute.semantics: May be null. Associates a treatment with a unique injury or symptom. If null, indicates that the treatment is not associated with a specific injury... for example, a treatment (oxygen administered to a patient at high altitude) may not be associated with a specific injury.

attribute.name: treatmentId
attribute.semantics:
The treatmentId is a unique value which associates a treatment to an injury and a patient. Once a treatmentId is created, it cannot be reused during an execution.
Naming Convention: Treatment_uniquevalue

attribute.name: treatmentLocation
attribute.semantics: May be null. Used to specify what part of the body a treatment is applied to IF a treatment is applied to a specific body location.

attribute.name: treatmentTime
attribute.semantics: This attribute indicates the time of the treatment in simulation elapsed time.

objectClass.name: MedicationTreatment
objectClass.semantics: This class covers items that are given in measured dosages including drugs, fluids and other medications.

attribute.name: medicationName
attribute.semantics: Specific name of the medication, if needed. May be null.

attribute.name: administrationRoute
attribute.semantics: Route by which the medication is administered.

attribute.name: dosageValue
attribute.semantics: Amount of medication administered. The base units are mL or mg depending on the medication.

attribute.name: dosageTimePeriod
attribute.semantics: The time period over which the medication is administered. If the value is 0, the medication is administered as a bolus. The base time period is minutes.

attribute.name: dosageActive
attribute.semantics: Indicates if a medication administration (e.g. drip) is active. True/1 = active, or False/0 = stopped. If active, the rate calculations continue until the attribute changes to 0. Bolus dosages will be 0.

attribute.name: analgesics
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type an analgesic?

attribute.name: sedation
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a sedative?

attribute.name: paralytics
attribute.semantics: Is the medication a paralytic?

attribute.name: pressers
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a vasopresser?

attribute.name: overdoseTreatment
attribute.semantics: Is the treatment an overdoseTreatment?

attribute.name: antiEmetics
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type an anti emetic?

attribute.name: anaphylaxisTreatment
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type an anaphylaxis?

attribute.name: respiratoryTreatment
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a respiratory treatment?

attribute.name: hypoglycemiaTreatment
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a hypoglycemiaTreatment?

attribute.name: cbrneTreatment
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a CBRNE treatment?

attribute.name: seizureTreatment
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a seizure treatment?

attribute.name: bloodProducts
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a blood product?

attribute.name: nutrition
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a nutrition product?

attribute.name: infectionMedication
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type for infection? If yes, select an enumeration.

attribute.name: clottingMedication
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type for clotting? If yes, select an enumeration.

attribute.name: cardiacMedication
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type for cardiac? If yes, select an enumeration.

attribute.name: fluidMedication
attribute.semantics: Is the medication type a fluid medication? If yes, select an enumeration.

objectClass.name: PhysicalTreatment
objectClass.semantics: This class covers treatments that are physically performed on the patient and may use devices or other equipment to perform the treatment.

attribute.name: treatment
attribute.semantics: Enumeration of the types of physical treatment administered to a patient.

attribute.name: deviceUsed
attribute.semantics: What device was used to administer the treatment

attribute.name: treatmentActive
attribute.semantics: Used to identify whether the treatment is active or inactive. True/1 = Active, False/0 = inactive

objectClass.name: Pathology
objectClass.semantics: Pathology object: Chronic conditions that are affecting the patient. Examples • Diabetes type 1 and 2 • Hypertension (chronic)

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular pathology.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

objectClass.name: PersonalData
objectClass.semantics: Personal data object: Base characteristics/demographics of the patient. Examples • age • weight • height

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular injuryId.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: firstName
attribute.semantics: First name of patient.

attribute.name: lastName
attribute.semantics: Last name of patient.

attribute.name: gender
attribute.semantics: Gender of patient.

attribute.name: dateOfBirth
attribute.semantics: Date of Birth of the patient.

attribute.name: weight
attribute.semantics: Weight of the patient in pounds.

attribute.name: height
attribute.semantics: Height of patient in inches.

objectClass.name: Location
objectClass.semantics: Used to represent the physical location of the patient.

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics: Associates a particular patient with a particular physical location.

attribute.name: location
attribute.semantics: Representation as Latitude, Longitude, Altitude

attribute.name: facilityId
attribute.semantics: Allows a patient to be associated with a facility (fixed or mobile). At that time, patient location would not be modeled, but facility ID could be used. Null means patient is not associated with a facility.

objectClass.name: NeurologicalScales
objectClass.semantics: Neurological scales are tools used by providers to measure certain aspects or responses of a patient. The measure of the scales relies on how the patient presents or describes signs and symptoms.

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: glasgowComaScale
attribute.semantics: GCS is a total of the scores for EyeOpeningResponse + BestVerbalResponse + BestMotorResponse.

attribute.name: levelOfResponse
attribute.semantics: AVPU Assessment.

attribute.name: levelOfConsciousness
attribute.semantics: General description of the patient's neurological state.

objectClass.name: Lab
objectClass.semantics: Represents lab values that can be measured from the patient. Includes blood analysis, urinalysis, blood gas analysis, and blood type analysis.

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: time
attribute.semantics: Simulation time that the lab was taken.

objectClass.name: BloodLab
objectClass.semantics: Blood Lab test. Some attributes may be null depending on the test administered.

attribute.name: bloodSodium
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: potassium
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: bloodChloride
attribute.semantics: Measured in mEq/L.

attribute.name: lactate
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: bloodKetones
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: fattyAcids
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: triglycerides
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL.

attribute.name: bloodCreatinine
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL.

attribute.name: bloodUreaNitrogen
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL.

attribute.name: bloodPhosphate
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL.

attribute.name: ionizedCalcium
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: bloodGlucose
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL.

attribute.name: hematocrit
attribute.semantics: Measured as a % from 0 to 100. Express as decimal.

attribute.name: hemoglobin
attribute.semantics: Measured in g/dL.

attribute.name: bloodPh
attribute.semantics: Unitless

attribute.name: bloodBicarbonate
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: baseExcess
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

objectClass.name: UrineLab
objectClass.semantics:
Attributes and measured values measured by a urine test. Attributes may be null depending on the particular tests administered.
The datatypes and values associated with each attribute are what would be determined if a full urine lab test was performed. For simulators using any type of strip, a mapping would need to be performed from what the lab values are, to the values the strip would return.

attribute.name: urobilinogen
attribute.semantics: Measured in umol/L.

attribute.name: urineGlucose
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: bilirubin
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL.

attribute.name: urineKetones
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: specificGravity
attribute.semantics: Unitless.

attribute.name: bloodInUrine
attribute.semantics: measured in RBC/uL (Red Blood cells per micro liter)

attribute.name: hemolysis
urinePh
attribute.semantics: Unitless.

attribute.name: protein
attribute.semantics: Measured in g/L.

attribute.name: nitrite
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL

attribute.name: leukocytes
attribute.semantics: measured in WBC/uL (White Blood cells per micro liter).

attribute.name: ascorbicAcid
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: urineSodium
attribute.semantics: Measured in mEq/L.

attribute.name: urineChloride
attribute.semantics: Measured in mEq/L.

attribute.name: urineCreatinine
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL.

attribute.name: urineBicarbonate
attribute.semantics: Measured in mEq/L.

attribute.name: ammonia
attribute.semantics: Measured in mcg/dL.

attribute.name: urinePhosphate
attribute.semantics: Measured in mg/dL.

attribute.name: urineUreaNitrogen
attribute.semantics: Measured in grams per 24 hours.

objectClass.name: BloodGasLab
objectClass.semantics: Parameters and measured values measured by a blood gas lab. Some values may be null, as different tests focus on a different subset of these attributes.

attribute.name: partialPressureCarbonDioxide
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmHg.

attribute.name: partialPressureOxygen
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmHg.

attribute.name: totalOxygenSaturation
attribute.semantics: Measured as a % from 0 to 100. Express as decimal.

attribute.name: totalCarbonDioxide
attribute.semantics: Measured in mmol/L.

attribute.name: sulfurDioxide
attribute.semantics: Measured as a % from 0 to 100. Express as decimal.

objectClass.name: BloodTypeLab
objectClass.semantics: Results of running the blood lab test. Default state is unknown.

attribute.name: bloodType
attribute.semantics: Blood Type of the patient

objectClass.name: RapidAssay
objectClass.semantics: Rapid Assay labs may be used to quickly identify a number of virus/bacterial infections including: Flu, Strep, HIV, COVID, H1N1, Malaria.

attribute.name: testName
attribute.semantics: Name of the rapid assay being administered.

attribute.name: result
attribute.semantics: Result of the rapid assay test administered.

objectClass.name: CreatePatient
objectClass.semantics: If multiple federates are interested in multiple patients, this object is an approach to telling which federates should model/observe a particular patient.

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular injuryId.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: target
attribute.semantics: Federate name(s) of the target(s) of this interaction. Multiple federate names separated by commas.

objectClass.name: BodyFluids
objectClass.semantics: The body fluids object is the ground truth data regarding various levels of body fluids of the patient. These are quantifiable measures, rather than observations as in the case of signs and symptoms.

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: bloodVolume
attribute.semantics: The current blood volume of the patient, in mL. Is affected by active hemorrhage (loss) and fluid resuscitation (gain). May be null if this quantity is not modeled.

attribute.name: bloodLossRate
attribute.semantics: The rate of blood loss in mL/min. While the hemorrhageRate attribute in the HemorrhageInjury class defines the initial injury attribute, this bloodLossRate attribute is reported in real time and reacts to treatments. May be null if this quantity is not modeled or is not part of the scenario.

attribute.name: urineOutputRate
attribute.semantics: The rate of urine production, in mL/min. May be null if this quantity is not modeled.

attribute.name: sweatRate
attribute.semantics: Amount of fluid lost as sweat, in mL. May be null if this quantity is not modeled.

interactionClass.name: PausePhysiologyEngine
interactionClass.semantics: Used to tell the physiology engine to pause patient modeling for the specific patient patientId

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular injuryId.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.
Unique string ID representing the patient. Links patient with injury, treatment, transportation

interactionClass.name: ResumePhysiologyEngine
interactionClass.semantics: Used to tell the physiology engine to resume modeling the patient identified by patientId. If patient is not paused, this interaction will be ignored.

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular injuryId.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.
Unique string ID representing the patient. Links patient with injury, treatment, transportation

interactionClass.name: CreateSymptoms
interactionClass.semantics:
Interaction to tell the PatientSimulator to create a Symptoms object. These parameters represent the initial conditions of the patient that are outwardly visible or measurable by the trainee.
The PatientSimulator needs to create the Symptoms object in order to update it.

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

parameter.name: levelOfConsciousnessGlasgowComaScale
parameter.semantics: Level Of Consciousness is a total of the scores for EyeOpeningResponse + BestVerbalResponse + BestMotorResponse.

parameter.name: levelOfPain
parameter.semantics: Level of pain 0-10.

parameter.name: levelOfConsciousnessAvpu
parameter.semantics: AVPU scale.

parameter.name: bleeding
parameter.semantics: Level of bleeding.

parameter.name: respiratoryDistress
parameter.semantics: SMOG breaths per minute <8 or >30.

parameter.name: torsoInjury
parameter.semantics: Torso or Chest injury impacting breathing.

parameter.name: confusion
parameter.semantics: Visible signs of confusion that the medic might observe or assess.

parameter.name: eye
parameter.semantics: Unequal dilated pupils, erratic eye movement.

interactionClass.name: RequestLab
interactionClass.semantics: This interaction could be viewed as a hospital order to perform a lab. If subscribing federate is not modeling some aspect of patientId, ignore this interaction.

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics:
patientId identifies a particular patient. patientId must be unique within an execution.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

parameter.name: labType
parameter.semantics: Type of lab being requested

interactionClass.name: LoadPatient
interactionClass.semantics: Interaction to tell the physiology engine to load a patient associated with patientId

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular injuryId.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.
Unique string ID representing the patient. Links patient with injury, treatment, transportation

interactionClass.name: StartPatient
interactionClass.semantics: Interaction to start modeling the patient state. If simulationElapsedTime is null, the start is immediate.

parameter.name: simulationElapsedTime
parameter.semantics: Simulation Elapsed time to begin patient modeling

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics: Identifies which patient to start modeling.

interactionClass.name: StopPatient
interactionClass.semantics: Interaction to stop modeling the patient state. If simulationElapsedTime is null, the start is immediate.

parameter.name: simulationElapsedTime
parameter.semantics: Simulation Elapsed time to stop patient modeling. This is an indication that the patient modeling will stop for the duration of the execution. Different from PausePatient.

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics: Identifies which patient to stop modeling.

interactionClass.name: PausePatient
interactionClass.semantics: Notification to pause (temporarily) modeling a patient. If simulationElapsedTime is null, the pause is immediate.

parameter.name: simulationElapsedTime
parameter.semantics: Simulation Elapsed time to pause patient modeling. If null, pause is immediate.

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics: Identifies which patient to pause modeling.

interactionClass.name: ResumePatient
interactionClass.semantics: Notification to resume modeling a paused patient. If simulationElapsedTime is null, the resume is immediate.

parameter.name: simulationElapsedTime
parameter.semantics: Simulation Elapsed time to resume patient modeling. If null, pause is immediate.

parameter.name: patientId
parameter.semantics: Identifies which patient to resume modeling.

enumeratedData.name: InjuryTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Each InjuryType will have a location and effect associated with it.

enumeratedData.name: PhysicalTreatmentTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Types of physical treatments that can be administered to a patient.

enumeratedData.name: SkinColorEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Description of skin color based on conditions or injuries. This is not the patient's base skin tone, but identifies differences from the base tone.

enumeratedData.name: CoughEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Description of the type of cough.

enumeratedData.name: VisionDisturbanceEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Description of the type of vision anomaly.

enumeratedData.name: TissueTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Types of tissue that might be injured.

enumeratedData.name: LevelOfResponseEnum
enumeratedData.semantics:
AVPU is a scale used to quickly identify the responsiveness of a patient to various stimuli.
Alert: The patient is fully awake (although not necessarily oriented). This patient will have spontaneously open eyes, will respond to voice (although may be confused) and will have bodily motor function.
Verbal: The patient makes some kind of response when you talk to them, which could be in any of the three component measures of eyes, voice or motor - e.g. patient's eyes open on being asked "Are you OK?". The response could be as little as a grunt, moan, or slight move of a limb when prompted by the voice of the rescuer.
Pain: The patient makes a response on any of the three component measures on the application of pain stimulus, such as a central pain stimulus like a sternal rub or a peripheral stimulus such as squeezing the fingers. A patient with some level of consciousness (a fully conscious patient would not require a pain stimulus) may respond by using their voice, moving their eyes, or moving part of their body (including abnormal posturing).
Unresponsive: Sometimes noted as 'Unconscious'.

fixedRecordData.name: DateOfBirthRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: Month, Day and Year of birth. Used to calculate age

field.name: rashRaised
field.semantics: Indicate if the rash is flat or raised. True/1 = raised. False/0 = not raised.

field.name: rashUniform
field.semantics: Indicate if the rash is uniform or spotty. True/1 = uniform. False/0 = spotty.

field.name: rashScab
field.semantics: Indicate if the rash has scabbed areas. True/1 = scabbed, False/0 = not scabbed.
